properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men Semi Final: Central Coast Mariners v Adelaide United. Game starts at 7:45pm and full time is around 9:35pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will be closed between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St from 5:45pm and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area

roads.mainStreet: Dane Drive

properties.publicTransport: Ticketholders are encouraged to catch public transport as parking at the Zoo and in surrounding streets is very limited. Ferries and buses run regularly to Taronga Zoo from the city and north shore. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney's iconic Tarong Zoo will light up during Vivid Sydney for two ticketed sessions at 5.30pm and 7.30pm on Wednesday to Sunday nights including public Holiday Monday. Pre-purchased event tickets are required.

No planned road closures or special event clearways will be in place around Taronga Zoo during Vivid however traffic will be heavy.

Motorists should expect delays on Military Rd, Spit Rd and Bradleys Head Rd as attendees travel to sessions starting at 5.30pm and 7.30pm.

Commuters are advised to allow additional travel time through Mosman during the evening peak on Wednesday, Thursday and Friday nights during Vivid.

roads.mainStreet: Bradleys Head Road, Military Road

webLinks.linkText: City of Sydney - Sydney Streets on Stanley Street

properties.publicTransport: Route 389 buses will be diverting around Stanley St while it's closed for the event. Check bus service alerts and plan your trip at transportnsw.info.

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney – Sydney Streets event on Stanley Street. The event runs from 11am until 10pm. 

  • Stanley St will be closed between Yurong St and Crown St in both directions from 9am to 11:30pm
  • Sections of Riley St, Yurong St and Chapel St will also be closed during this time
  • Motorists will be detoured via Crown St, William St, College St and Francis St

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 8am on Saturday 20 May until 12:30am on Sunday 21 May on sections of Stanley St, Riley St, Yurong St, Crown St and Chapel St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

DARLINGHURST – 9AM TO 11:30PM

  • Riley Street between Stanley Street and Francis Lane
  • Stanley Street between Yurong Street and Crown Street
  • Yurong Street* between William Street and Stanley Lane
  • Yurong Street** between Francis Street and Francis Lane
  • Chapel St^ west from Crown Street, along Chapel Street and Francis Lane

*Resident only access from William Street to Yurong Street

**Resident only access from Yurong Street to Francis Street (east of Yurong Street) and Francis Lane

^Resident only access from Crown Street, along Chapel Street to Francis Lane

If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Dragons v Roosters at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium. Kick-off from 6pm and full time approx. 7:45pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Local roads around the stadium will close ahead of kick-off including Jubilee Avenue, Park Street and English Street. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sharks v Knights at C.ex Coffs International Stadium. Kick-off from 3pm and full time around 5pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on the Pacfic Hwy at Stadium Dr as footy fans travel to and from the game.

Motorists should allow extra travel time in the area.

roads.mainStreet: Pacific Highway and Stadium Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
Wests Tigers v Cowboys at Leichhardt Oval. Kick-off from 5:30pm and full time around 7:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Mary St, Glover St, Perry St, Lilyfield Rd and Balmain Rd as attendees travel to and from the event.

Mary St may be partially closed at the oval before the game to allow attendees to safely arrive and leave the venue after the game. Local detours via Chapel St will be in place.

Motorists requiring to access other venues in the Park should use either Maliyawul St or Glover St.

Attendees driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Mary Street

properties.otherAdvice:
Rosehill Gardens Race Day Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. First race at 11am, last race from 4:25pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

roads.mainStreet: James Ruse Drive

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Rabbitohs v Eels at Allianz Stadium. NSW Cup from 5:15pm. NRL kick-off at 8pm and fullt ime around 10pm.

With up to 30,000 people expected, traffic will be heavier than usual and parking in the precinct is expected to fill quickly.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 4pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave. Access to EP2 Kippax car park will be maintained via Moore Park Rd and access to EP3 grass car park and drop off areas maintained from Lang Rd.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until 11pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
Eric Chou at Qudos Bank Arena. Show starts from 7:30pm and finishes around 10pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: GWS Giants v St Kilda at GIANTS Stadium. First bounce at 4:40pm, finish approx 6:30pm.

Traffic may be heavy on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Allow extra travel time and arrive early as thousands of NRL fans will be leaving the precinct after a match at nearby Accor Stadium while AFL fans arrive. 

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close some local roads to accommodate increased public transport services and ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, visit Sydney Olympic Park Authority and check out the interactive map.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on trains. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Bulldogs v Titans at Accor Stadium. NRL kick-off from 2pm, full time around 3:45pm.

Traffic will be heavier on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Traffic may also be heavy in the precinct when leaving after the game as AFL fans arrive for s match at nearby GIANTS Stadium. 

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close some local roads to accommodate increased public transport services and ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, visit Sydney Olympic Park Authority and check out the interactive map.

Fans are encouraged to pre-book their parking online, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in event tickets. Light rail services and buses run frequently to Moore Park so leave the car at home. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

properties.otherAdvice:
Super Rugby: Waratahs v Fijian Drua at Allianz Stadium. Test Rugby at 5pm. Super Rugby from 7:35pm and full time around 9:10pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd as fans travel to and from the game.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 3:15pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game. No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave, however access to the EP3 grass car park (open from 4:30pm) and drop off areas will be maintained from Lang Rd - from the Eastern Distributor use the Randwick exit. EP2 Car park will be closed.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm to 11pm on sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
Lane closures will be in place on Market Street in the Sydney CBD as crowds are expected to attend the Little Mermaid Premiere at the State Theatre from 5:30pm.

From 3am until midnight, lane 1 of the southern side Market St and lane 4 of the northern side of Market St will be closed between Pitt St and George St.

The footpath on the southern side of Market St will also be closed between Pitt St and George St from 10am until 10pm. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads around the theatre.

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney Sydney Streets event in Haymarket. The event runs from 11am until 10pm. 

  • Hay St will be closed in both directions between Sussex St and Harbour St from 9am until 11:30pm.
  • Sections of Harbour St, Sussex St, Little Hay St, Factory St, Kimber Ln and Little Pier St will also be closed during this time.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 8am until 11:30pm on sections of Hay St, Harbour St, Sussex St and Little Hay St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee apply

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and clearways will be in effect for the Walk with Christ Religious Procession in the Sydney CBD between 2.30pm and 4.30pm from Martin Place to St Marys Cathedral.

Traffic will be heavy in the city while roads are closed. Motorists should avoid unnecessary travel through the city where possible or allow plenty of extra travel time.

Road closures:

  • From 2:30pm to 4:30pm sections of Pitt, O'Connell, Bligh, Spring, Castlereagh, Phillip, King, Elizabeth, George and Hunter Streets will close.
  • From 2:50pm to 4:30pm sections of College St, Macquarie St, Prince Albert Rd and St James Rd will close.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 1pm until 4pm on sections of College, Hunter, Macquarie and Pitt Streets. Clearways are strict no-parking zones and apply even to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit Holders. Check signs carefully before parking as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

properties.otherAdvice:
Major road closures will be in place on Sunday morning between 4am and 11:30am in the Sydney CBD, The Rocks, Dawes Point, Millers Point, Barangaroo and Pyrmont for the Runaway Sydney Half Marathon. 10km event starts from 6.30am followed by Half Marathon at 7.25am. Events start from Bridge St at Macquarie St corner of Cahill Exp finishing at St Mary's Cathedral Square on College St.

Motorists are encouraged to avoid non-essential travel in the CBD and Pyrmont areas during the event as delays are expected. Diversions will be in place, follow detour signs and allow extra travel time.

Key road closures:

  • Hyde Park from 2am to 2.30pm: College St between Prince Albert Rd and Park St (event finish line).
  • Circular Quay from 4am to 9.30am: sections of Bridge St and Phillip St.
  • Cahill Expressway and Sydney CBD from 4am to 11:30am: the Cahill Expressway Circular Quay overpass, and sections of Bridge St, Macquarie St and Kent St northbound from Napoleon St.
  • The Sydney Harbour Bridge remains open. Motorists travelling southbound to the Eastern Suburbs can use the Sydney Harbour Tunnel or travel through the CBD to access the Eastern Distributor.
  • The Rocks, Millers Point and Barangaroo from 5am to 11am: Hickson Rd, Argyle St, Pottinger St, Watson Rd, Dalgety Rd and surrounding local roads.
  • Sydney CBD from 5am to 11:30am: Macquarie St between Bent St and St James Rd and Hunter St between Elizabeth St and Macquarie St.
  • The Domain from 5am to 12pm: Art Gallery Rd, Mrs Macquaries Rd, St Marys Rd, Hospital Rd and Yurong Pkwy.
  • Sydney CBD from 6am to 11am: Bent St and Shakespeare Place cross over closed. Motorists can travel east/west of the city via Park St or Goulburn St.
  • Western Distributor from 6am to 9.30am: the Western Distributor from Pyrmont to the CBD including Fig St/Pyrmont St on-ramps and King St off-ramps will be closed. Motorists travelling citybound on the Anzac Bridge will be detoured via the Bathurst Street off-ramp to rejoin the Harbour Bridge. There will be no direct access from the Anzac Bridge to the Sydney Harbour Bridge until 9.30am.
  • Barangaroo and Pyrmont from 6am to 9.30am: sections of Erskine St, Sussex St, Wheat Rd, Darling Dr, Pyrmont St, Pyrmont Bridge Rd, Murray St, Edward St and Union St.
  • Pyrmont from 6am to 10am: sections of Bank St, Bowman St, Harris St, Pirrama Rd north, Refinery Dr, Darling Island Rd and surrounding local roads.
  • Pyrmont from 6am to 10:30am: Pirrama Rd between Darling Island Rd and Union St.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on various roads throughout the Sydney CBD, Circular Quay, The Rocks, Millers Point and Pyrmont between 12.01am and 12pm midday. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

arrangementElements.html:
Circular Quay:

  • Access will be managed under traffic control to properties on Albert St, Macquarie St (North of Albert St) and Phillip Lane throughout the closures for local residents/hotel guests only. Entry via Bridge St and Loftus St. Exit via Young St and Bridge St

Sydney Hospital & Hospital Rd

  • From 5am to 12pm: Two-way access to Hospital Rd via Shakespeare Place under traffic control contra flow arrangements.

King St Wharf and Barangaroo South

  • Access to and from King St Wharf, Cockle Bay Wharf and Barangaroo will be restricted to tenants/residents only and managed via Wheat Rd under traffic control between 7am and 9.30am. No access via Erskine St or Sussex St.
  • Entry: via Harbour St continue Western Distributor northbound veer left into Wheat Rd at the signposted exit for Erskine St / CBD North
  • Exit: Light vehicles will be able to exit the precinct via Wheat Rd southbound under two-way traffic control. Vehicles over 7 metres (including trucks, buses and coaches) will be unable to use the managed exit and will need to remain within the precinct until Erskine St reopens at 9.30am.
  • Before and after these times access is maintained via Erskine St at Kent St. We strongly advise motorists to avoid non-essential travel to or from these precincts between 7am and 9am as delays are expected.

Millers Point

  • Managed local access to properties on Kent St as far north as Argyle St, and High St, will be managed under traffic control at the Kent St & Napoleon St intersection for the duration of the event. Access via High St to Argyle Place, west of Kent St only.
  • Kent St southbound exit allowed for local traffic only.

Barangaroo Reserve

  • From 9am to 11am: Access to Barangaroo Reserve & car park, Dalgety Rd and Bettington St will be available from 9am until 11am only, entry via Kent St, High St, Argyle Pl, and Dalgety Rd.

The Rocks & Dawes Point local access:

  • Maintained via Lang St & Harrington St throughout the event.

Pyrmont

  • Murray St properties between Union St and Pyrmont St, and Wilson Parking 100 Murray St:
  • between 6am and 9.30am access to and from properties/hotels on Murray St and surrounding local roads will be permitted under traffic control via Darling Drive for light vehicles and coaches only (trucks not permitted). Note, coaches can only turn around via hotel driveways.
  • The Star: between 6am and 9.30am access to and from The Star car park is via Pyrmont St only
  • Refinery Dr: Refinery Dr will be closed from 6am to 10am with exit permitted via Tambua St before 7:15am and after 9:45am only at Police discretion when there are safe gaps between runners. If you need access to your vehicle/property during these times, please plan ahead and relocate your vehicle prior. Refinery Drive residents are also reminded that strict clearway parking restrictions will be in effect from 3am to 10.30am on both sides of the road.
  • Pyrmont St properties between Bunn St and Murray St: exit from driveways permitted throughout event under traffic control
  • Wharf 7 and 10: From 6am to 10.30am, no access from/to Pirrama Rd from Wharf 7 and Wharf 10 access roads
arrangementElements.title: Managed local access arrangements

arrangementElements.html:
Cycleway Closures

  • College St between Park St and St Mary’s Rd - 2:00am to 2:30pm
  • King St between Phillip St Sth and Macquarie St - 5:00am to 11:30am - No access to Macquarie St from King St Cycleway
  • King St between Kent St and Sussex St – 6:00am to 9:30am
  • Union St between Edward St and Murray St - 6:00am to 10:30am 

Cycling Detours

From 06:45AM to 11:00AM

Cycling detours will be in place between Kent St cycleway and Sydney Harbour Bridge cycleway, via Observatory Hill. Marshals will direct cyclists across Upper Fort St in both directions when safe gaps between runners present.

Alternatively, cyclists can travel between Sydney Harbour Bridge cycleway and Sydney CBD via Cumberland St.
arrangementElements.title: Cycleway closure

properties.diversions: Buses in the city and Pyrmont will be diverting while road closures are in place. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

roads.mainStreet: Cahill Expressway, Western Distributor, Macquarie Street, Hickson Road

properties.publicTransport: On Fridays from 6pm and weekends from 5pm buses and light rail services will not run to Circular Quay. Buses will be relocated to stops at Martin Place and light rail services will run to and from Town Hall only. On Saturday nights and Sunday of the long weekend trains will not drop off passengers at Circular Quay. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your Vivid Sydney experience.
properties.otherAdvice:
Vivid Sydney returns for its 13th year to light up the city for 23 consecutive nights from Friday 26 May to Saturday 17 June from 6pm to 11pm each night. Road closures and special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect each night. 

Road closures:

Nightly:

  • 12pm midday - midnight: Cumberland St south of Essex St
  • 3pm - midnight: Circular Quay West at the Overseas Passenger Terminal.

Monday to Thursdays

  • 5pm – midnight: closures in The Rocks including George St north of Alfred St, Hickson Rd to Pottinger St and sections of Pitt St, Pottinger St, Lower Fort St, Loftus St and other local streets.
  • 7pm – midnight: northbound lanes of George St closed from Grosvenor St to Essex St. 

Fridays

  • 2pm – midnight: local roads in The Rocks including Atherden St and Playfair St. From 12pm midday Friday to 1am Monday, George St will close between Lower Fort St and Hickson Rd for the Rocks markets.
  • 5pm – midnight: closures in The Rocks and Walsh Bay including George St north of Alfred St, Hickson Rd to Pottinger St, High St, Dalgety Rd and surrounding local streets.
  • 6pm – midnight: roads in Circular Quay north of Bridge St including sections of Pitt, Young, Phillip and Loftus Streets, and Darling Dr between Pier St and Ultimo Rd.
  • 7pm – midnight: northbound lanes of George St from Grosvenor St to Essex St, and sections of Kent St, Lower Fort St, Essex St and Windmill St.

Saturdays and Sunday (11 June) of the long weekend 

  • 5pm - 1am: major closures in Sydney CBD north including Circular Quay, The Rocks and Walsh Bay. Sections of Grosvenor St, Bridge St, Jamison St, Margaret St, Hunter St, George St north of King St, Hickson Rd to Pottinger St, sections of Pitt, Young, Phillip and Loftus Streets north of Bridge St, and Railway Colonnade at Central Station. No access east/west across the city via Grosvenor/Bridge Streets.
  • 5.30pm - midnight: Darling Dr between Pier St and Ultimo Rd
  • 7pm - midnight: Wheat Rd from Harbour St at Darling Harbour.

Sundays and Monday 12 June (public holiday)    

  • 5pm – midnight: closures in Circular Quay, The Rocks and Walsh Bay including George St north of Grosvenor St, Hickson Rd to Pottinger St, and sections of Pitt, Young, Phillip and Loftus Streets.
  • 5.30pm – midnight: Darling Dr between Pier St and Ultimo Rd.

Managed access to some hotels and businesses around The Rocks and Circular Quay will be maintained by traffic controllers on-site throughout Vivid Sydney when safe to do so.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect from 3pm to midnight each night on various key roads around Circular Quay and The Rocks, with more widespread clearways in the Sydney CBD in effect on weekends.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

roads.suburb: Sydney CBD, Circular Quay, The Rocks, Walsh Bay, Barangaroo, Darling Harbour

properties.publicTransport: Buses may be delayed while closures are in place. Check transportnsw.info/alerts for the latest info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Rolling road closures will be in place from Town Hall to Pyrmont between approximately 1:30pm and 3pm, for a planned Police Operation.

FROM 1:30PM TO 3PM

  • Park Street between Pitt Street and George Street (westbound)
  • Druitt Street between George Street and Kent Street (both directions)
  • Clarence Street between Druitt Street and Market Street (northbound)
  • Market Street between Clarence Street and Sussex Street (westbound)
  • Murray Street between Pyrmont Bridge Road and Pirrama Street (northbound)
  • Pirrama Street between Murray Street and Jones Bay Road/Darling Island Road (westbound)

Roads will progressively reopen when safe to do so under Police escort.

Motorists should avoid the area during this time or expect delays and follow the directions of NSW Police on site.
